info.author: Philip Pavlik ppavlik@memphis.edu
info.abstract: The LKT component is implements logisitc knowledge tracing.
info.details:
This LKT component fits models usign the LKT package in R https://github.com/Optimal-Learning-Lab/LKT. Below are examples of how to fill in the boxes for models with various numbers of terms.
For each term, there can be a feature, a component the feature applies to, a list of fixed parameters (assuming the feature needs these), and a list of seed paramters (used if fixed parameters needed but not provided). These feature are documented in this paper https://arxiv.org/abs/2005.00869 and in the R package above.
The $ operator computes coefficients for each level of the KC for the feature. The @ operator computes the feature as a random effect, and may only be used for random intercepts. Note: single-KC models should not be attempted, but using LKT, a feature that is computed per Anon Student Id level is equivalent to a single-KC model.
Examples:
To produce modified AFM with fixed-effect intercept for KC, propdec used to trace overall student learning, and only a single slope for learning. :
Term 1: propdec; Anon Student Id; .9
Term 2: intercept; KC (Default)
Term 3: lineafm; KC (Default)
To produce standard AFM with random-effect intercepts for student and KC and per KC lineafm learning (linear effect of opportunities):
Term 1: intercept@; Anon Student Id
Term 2: intercept@; KC (Default)
Term 3: lineafm$; KC (Default)
To produce intercepts and some feature fits to clusters (ones that don't rely on timing factors). In the example, term 2 finds a coefficient for the log of prior success in cluster 1 only. :
Term 1: intercept; Clusters
Term 2: logsuc; KC (Default)%Clusters%1
To produce standard PFA with random-effect intercepts for student and KC:
Term 1: intercept@; Anon Student Id
Term 2: intercept@; KC (Default)
Term 3: linesuc$; KC (Default)
Term 4: linefail$; KC (Default)
To produce AFM with fixed-effect intercepts for student and KC and long-term forgetting:
Term 1: intercept; Anon Student Id
Term 2: intercept; KC (Default)
Term 3: base2$; KC (Default); .3,.05
To produce AFM model with fixed-effect intercepts for student and KC, KC long-term forgetting, and item level PFA (simple hierarcical domain model)
Term 1: intercept; Anon Student Id
Term 2: intercept; KC (Default)
Term 3: base2$; KC (Default); .3,.05
Term 4: linesuc$; KC (Item)
Term 5: linefail$; KC (Item)
To produce PFA with student ability tracing :
Term 1: propdec; Anon Student Id; .9
Term 2: intercept; KC (Default)
Term 3: linesuc$; KC (Default)
Term 4: linefail$; KC (Default)
To produce PFA with long-term forgetting and random-effect intercepts for student and KC:
Term 1: intercept@; Anon Student Id
Term 2: intercept@; KC (Default)
Term 3: base2suc$; KC (Default); .3,.05
Term 4: base2fail$; KC (Default); .3,.05

inputs.b: Transaction export with LKT features (for some models).

outputs.b: Transaction export with model predictions attached, R model output with parameter values, R model fit statistics in xml

options.p: Modle Name - passed to subsequent components for graphing.
Model Terms - The user can specify up to 10 terms. See details.
Global intercept - Some models may want a single fixed intercept to be fit.
Fixed NLPs - Do any of the terms require a fixed non-linear parameter?
Seed NLPs - Do any of the terms require a search seed non-linear parameter?
Fixed coefficients - Do any of the terms use a fixed regression coefficient that is not optimizied.
